author: hack3r_0m
content: hey guys, want to understand more on 63/64 rule. 1/64 is left for caller while making call to callee. how do system ensure that 1/64 is abundant for remaining operations on caller side? how does system(and which part of evm or client) makes sure that actually 1/64 has been left for caller? why 63/64 and not any other fraction? I read eip but it is not completly clear to me

author: _shemnon
content: The max gas available for the in the message frame for the sub call is at most 63/64, even if it is larger than requested by the call.  That way when the child message frame resolves and gas is deducted at most 63/64 is deducted.  Not sure why it was all but 1/64.
